title: INTERNATIONAL LAW AND EMPIRE: HISTORICAL EXPLORATIONS
description: Author: Martti Koskenniemi, Walter Rech, Manuel Jimenez Fonseca Edition: 1 edition Publication Date: March 5, 2017 Publisher: Oxford University Press ISBN-10: 0198795572 ISBN-13: 978-0198795575 Pages: 416 pages Format: pdf Size: 2.7M --- In times in which global governance in its various forms, such as human rights, international trade law, and development projects, is increasingly promoted by transnational economic actors and international institutions that seem to be detached from democratic processes of legitimation, the question of the relationship between international law and empire is as topical as ever. By examining this relationship in historical contexts from early modernity to the present, this volume aims to deepen current understandings of the way international legal institutions, practices, and narratives have shaped specifically imperial ideas about and structures of world governance. --- http://dlfeb.com/book/international-law-and-empire-historical-explorations-history-and-theory-of-international-law/

parsed.dn: INTERNATIONAL LAW AND EMPIRE: HISTORICAL EXPLORATIONS
